intro: Drymospartum sardum, commonly known as the Sardinian drymospartum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
